Oh yeah ... the menu items _are_ there.  Just apparently non-functional.

Thanks for the log.
It appears that the org.eclipse.update.configurator is not exporting its 
classes (FeatureEntry in this case). This seems odd, as things appear to be 
working fine on Windows. 
Can you find any log entries that show some plugins have been 
uninstalled/disabled/etc. ?

Here is the complete log of a session where I started eclipse, clicked on Manage
Configuration, and then shut down:

As an added note, I use the e-p-i-c perl editor, and it doesn't seem to be
picking up features either ... is it possible that I am experiencing a problem
with the whole feature subsystem?

It looks like a corrupted install to me, an you're running out of the cached 
plugins. 
Try installing it clean and see if that fixes the problem.

Yup.  Invalid is so much more polite than "The User Is An Idiot".
I can't believe that I forgot and also wasted your time.  Thanks.
